intro: Gratiola lutea var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth yellow germander, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in moist, grassy areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
